title: Australian administrative elites and the challenges of digital-era change
research_description: The article examines how Australian administrative elites have responded to digital-era changes, focusing on their role in adopting and implementing big data and AI technologies. It explores the cultural shifts among senior officials and the challenges posed by rapid technological advancements, especially in governance and service delivery.
research_results: The research highlights that Australian administrative elites have increasingly prioritized digital change, particularly in response to disruptive innovations in the private sector. However, there are significant barriers, including resistance to large-scale IT projects and concerns about privacy and data quality.
future_research: Future research could explore the long-term impacts of digital transformation on public administration, especially in terms of the sustainability of AI-driven governance models and the ethical implications of big data use in public services.
